sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.description: Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.
sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayoutRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCells cells} : sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Grid control.
Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.

sap.ui.commons.Slider.description: The interactive control is displayed either as a horizontal or a vertical line with a pointer and units of measurement. Users can move the pointer along the line to change values with graphical support.
sap.ui.commons.Slider.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Slider. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getMin min} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMax max} : float (default: 100)
    • {@link #getValue value} : float (default: 50)
    • {@link #getSmallStepWidth smallStepWidth} : float
    • {@link #getTotalUnits totalUnits} : int
    • {@link #getStepLabels stepLabels} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLabels labels} : string[]
    • {@link #getVertical vertical} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Slider.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Slider control.
The interactive control is displayed either as a horizontal or a vertical line with a pointer and units of measurement. Users can move the pointer along the line to change values with graphical support.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

listBox.description: Using this method, you provide a ListBox control. This allows reuse of item lists in different controls. Either a control id can be used as new target, or a control instance. Note: The ListBox must not be rendered somewhere in the UI. But if you want to bind the ListBox items to a model it must be in the control tree. So we suggest to add it as dependent somewhere (e.g. to the view or the first used ComboBox). If it is not set as child or dependant to an other control it will be automatically set as dependent to the first ComboBox where it is assigned.
listBox.helpDescription: Using this method, you provide a ListBox control. This allows reuse of item lists in different controls. Either a control id can be used as new target, or a control instance. Note: The ListBox must not be rendered somewhere in the UI. But if you want to bind the ListBox items to a model it must be in the control tree. So we suggest to add it as dependent somewhere (e.g. to the view or the first used ComboBox). If it is not set as child or dependant to an other control it will be automatically set as dependent to the first ComboBox where it is assigned.

sap.ui.commons.AutoComplete.description: Textfield with list based text completion.
sap.ui.commons.AutoComplete.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AutoComplete. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableScrolling enableScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:suggest suggest} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.ComboBox#constructor sap.ui.commons.ComboBox} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.AutoComplete.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Textfield with list based text completion.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

selectedKey.description:
Key of the selected item.

If the value has no corresponding item the key is empty.

If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

If the key is set to a not existing value it will not be changed.
selectedKey.helpDescription:

enableScrolling.description: Determines whether scrolling should be enabled when the number of items is higher than maxPopupItems. If set to false only the first n items (n=maxPopupItems) are shown.

sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea.description: The BorderLayoutArea represents one area of a BorderLayout
sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/BorderLayoutArea. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAreaId areaId} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutAreaTypes (default: top)
    • {@link #getOverflowX overflowX} : string (default: auto)
    • {@link #getOverflowY overflowY} : string (default: auto)
    • {@link #getContentAlign contentAlign} : string (default: left)
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100px)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Page control.

sap.ui.commons.Link.description: Provides an absolute or relative reference to an internal or external URL. The classical target parameters are supported. Another usage scenario is triggering an action, for example to open a popup window. In both cases, the link is a hypertext link.
sap.ui.commons.Link.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Link. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHelpId helpId} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getHref href} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getTarget target} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Link.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Link control.

sap.ui.commons.Message.description: Creates the "Message"s to be supplied to the "MessageBar" Control.
sap.ui.commons.Message.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Message. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.ui.commons.MessageType
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getAssociatedElementId associatedElementId} : string
    • {@link #getDesign design} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Message.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 A new messaging concept will be created in future. Therefore this control might be removed in one of the next versions.
Creates the "Message"s to be supplied to the "MessageBar" Control.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. sap.ui.commons.RatingIndicator.description: RatingIndicator is used to let the user do some rating on a given topic. The amount of rating symbols can be specified, as well as the URIs to the image icons which shall be used as rating symbols. When the user performs a rating, an event is fired.
sap.ui.commons.RatingIndicator.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RatingIndicator. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMaxValue maxValue} : int (default: 5)
    • {@link #getValue value} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getAverageValue averageValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconUnselected iconUnselected} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconHovered iconHovered} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getVisualMode visualMode} : sap.ui.commons.RatingIndicatorVisualMode (default: Half)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.RatingIndicator.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.RatingIndicator control.
RatingIndicator is used to let the user do some rating on a given topic. The amount of rating symbols can be specified, as well as the URIs to the image icons which shall be used as rating symbols. When the user performs a rating, an event is fired.

sap.ui.commons.SegmentedButton.description: The SegmentedButton provides a group of multiple buttons. Only one button can be active. The behaviour is more ore less like a radio button group.
sap.ui.commons.SegmentedButton.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SegmentedButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getButtons buttons} : sap.ui.commons.Button[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedButton selectedButton} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.commons.Button)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.SegmentedButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.SegmentedButton control.
The SegmentedButton provides a group of multiple buttons. Only one button can be active. The behaviour is more ore less like a radio button group.

Constructor for a new ToolbarSeparator. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup.description: The RadioButtonGroup is a basic control that is used to provide area for making interactive choice out of a set of options. It represents a list with items where exactly one item can be selected in a session. For the representation of the single group entries, the RadioButton items are created automatically. For the RadioButton choice, mouse and keyboard navigation usage is supported.
sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RadioButtonGroup. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getSelectedIndex selectedIndex} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.RadioButtonGroup control.
The RadioButtonGroup is a basic control that is used to provide area for making interactive choice out of a set of options. It represents a list with items where exactly one item can be selected in a session. For the representation of the single group entries, the RadioButton items are created automatically. For the RadioButton choice, mouse and keyboard navigation usage is supported.

sap.ui.commons.SearchField.description: Allows the user to type search queries and to trigger the search. Optionally, suggestions can be added.
sap.ui.commons.SearchField.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SearchField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableListSuggest enableListSuggest} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowListExpander showListExpander} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableClear enableClear} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowExternalButton showExternalButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableCache enableCache} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableFilterMode enableFilterMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getVisibleItemCount visibleItemCount} : int (default: 20)
    • {@link #getStartSuggestion startSuggestion} : int (default: 3)
    • {@link #getMaxSuggestionItems maxSuggestionItems} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getMaxHistoryItems maxHistoryItems} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSearchProvider searchProvider} : sap.ui.core.search.SearchProvider
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:suggest suggest} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.commons.RadioButton.description:
RadioButton is a control similar to CheckBox, but it allows the user to choose only one of the predefined set of options.

Usually, RadioButton is used in a group with other RadioButtons (with the groupName property or by using sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup), thus providing a limited choice for the user. An event is triggered when the user makes a change of the selection.
sap.ui.commons.RadioButton.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RadioButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getGroupName groupName} : string (default: sapUiRbDefaultGroup)
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.RadioButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.RadioButton control.
RadioButton is a control similar to CheckBox, but it allows the user to choose only one of the predefined set of options. Usually, RadioButton is used in a group with other RadioButtons (with the groupName property or by using sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup), thus providing a limited choice for the user. An event is triggered when the user makes a change of the selection.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.commons.Toolbar.description: A horizontal row of items where in many cases the single toolbar items are buttons containing icons. Note that all controls with the sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem interface can be used as item: Button, ComboBox, TextField.
sap.ui.commons.Toolbar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Toolbar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getDesign design} : sap.ui.commons.ToolbarDesign (default: Flat)
    • {@link #getStandalone standalone} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem[] (default)
    • {@link #getRightItems rightItems} : sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Toolbar.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Toolbar control.
A horizontal row of items where in many cases the single toolbar items are buttons containing icons. Note that all controls with the sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem interface can be used as item: Button, ComboBox, TextField.

The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.commons.RoadMap.description: RoadMap is used to display step-by-step work flows of a clearly defined work process.
sap.ui.commons.RoadMap.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RoadMap. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getNumberOfVisibleSteps numberOfVisibleSteps} : int
    • {@link #getFirstVisibleStep firstVisibleStep} : string
    • {@link #getSelectedStep selectedStep} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSteps steps} : sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:stepSelected stepSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:stepExpanded stepExpanded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.RoadMap.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Wizard control.
RoadMap is used to display step-by-step work flows of a clearly defined work process.

sap.ui.commons.Label.description: The control is used for labeling other controls. The API provides formatting options, for example, for bold display or alignment. A label can have an icon.
sap.ui.commons.Label.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Label. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDesign design} : sap.ui.commons.LabelDesign (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRequiredAtBegin requiredAtBegin} : boolean
  • Associations
    • {@link #getLabelFor labelFor} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Label.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Label control.
The control is used for labeling other controls. The API provides formatting options, for example, for bold display or alignment. A label can have an icon.

sap.ui.commons.layout.PositionContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/PositionContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTop top} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getBottom bottom} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getLeft left} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getRight right} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getCenterHorizontally centerHorizontally} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getCenterVertically centerVertically} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getControl control} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

listBox.description: Using this method, you provide a ListBox control. This allows reuse of item lists in different controls. Either a control id can be used as new target, or a control instance. Note: The ListBox must not be rendered somewhere in the UI. But if you want to bind the ListBox items to a model it must be in the control tree. So we suggest to add it as dependent somewhere (e.g. to the view or the first used ComboBox). If it is not set as child or dependant to an other control it will be automatically set as dependent to the first ComboBox where it is assigned.
listBox.helpDescription: Using this method, you provide a ListBox control. This allows reuse of item lists in different controls. Either a control id can be used as new target, or a control instance. Note: The ListBox must not be rendered somewhere in the UI. But if you want to bind the ListBox items to a model it must be in the control tree. So we suggest to add it as dependent somewhere (e.g. to the view or the first used ComboBox). If it is not set as child or dependant to an other control it will be automatically set as dependent to the first ComboBox where it is assigned.

sap.ui.commons.ComboBox.description: The control provides a field that allows end users to either enter some text, or to choose an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.
sap.ui.commons.ComboBox.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ComboBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getMaxPopupItems maxPopupItems} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getDisplaySecondaryValues displaySecondaryValues} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey} : string
    • {@link #getSelectedItemId selectedItemId} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.ListItem[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getListBox listBox} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.commons.ListBox)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.TextField#constructor sap.ui.commons.TextField} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.ComboBox.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.ComboBox control.
The control provides a field that allows end users to either enter some text, or to choose an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

pageSize.description: The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.
pageSize.helpDescription: The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.

sap.ui.commons.Paginator.description: Provides navigation between pages within a list of numbered pages.
sap.ui.commons.Paginator.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Paginator. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCurrentPage currentPage} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getNumberOfPages numberOfPages} : int
  • Events
    • {@link #event:page page} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Paginator.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Provides navigation between pages within a list of numbered pages.

sap.ui.commons.ApplicationHeader.description: The application header control stands on the top of any application page. It consists of 4 areas: Logo area, Function area provided by application, Search area, Logout area.
sap.ui.commons.ApplicationHeader.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ApplicationHeader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLogoSrc logoSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getLogoText logoText} : string
    • {@link #getDisplayLogoff displayLogoff} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUserName userName} : string
    • {@link #getDisplayWelcome displayWelcome} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:logoff logoff} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.commons.Dialog.description: An interactive window appearing on request displaying information to the user. The API supports features such as popups with fixed sizes, popups with unlimited width, scrolling bars for large windows, and control nesting (for example, a drop-down list can be included in the window).
sap.ui.commons.Dialog.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Dialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize

    • {@link #getScrollTop scrollTop} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: )

    • {@link #getShowCloseButton showCloseButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getResizable resizable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMinWidth minWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize

    • {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize

sap.ui.commons.Dialog.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Dialog control.
An interactive window appearing on request displaying information to the user. The API supports features such as popups with fixed sizes, popups with unlimited width, scrolling bars for large windows, and control nesting (for example, a drop-down list can be included in the window).

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

buttons.description: Aggregation of the buttons to display at the bottom of the dialog, for example OK and Cancel. Association defaultButton can be used for one of the defined buttons.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

modal.description: Specifies whether the dialog should be modal, or not. In case of true the focus is kept inside the dialog.

keepInWindow.description: Specifies whether Dialog movement should be restricted to the visible area of the window. This only affects drag&drop movements by the user. This doesn't affect modal dialogs -> modal dialogs always stay in the window.

sap.ui.commons.ListBox.description: Provides a list of items from which users can choose an item. For the design of the list box, features such as defining the list box height, fixing the number of visible items, choosing one item to be the item that is marked by default when the list box is shown, or a scroll bar for large list boxes are available.
sap.ui.commons.ListBox.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ListBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAllowMultiSelect allowMultiSelect} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getScrollTop scrollTop} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getDisplayIcons displayIcons} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDisplaySecondaryValues displaySecondaryValues} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValueTextAlign valueTextAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValueTextAlign secondaryValueTextAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getMinWidth minWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxWidth maxWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getVisibleItems visibleItems} : int
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.ListBox.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.List control.
Provides a list of items from which users can choose an item. For the design of the list box, features such as defining the list box height, fixing the number of visible items, choosing one item to be the item that is marked by default when the list box is shown, or a scroll bar for large list boxes are available.

editable.description: Determines whether the ListBox is interactive or not. Can be used to disable interaction with mouse or keyboard.
editable.helpDescription: Determines whether the ListBox is interactive or not. Can be used to disable interaction with mouse or keyboard.

valueTextAlign.description: Determines the text alignment in the primary ListBox column.
valueTextAlign.helpDescription: Determines the text alignment in the primary ListBox column.

visibleItems.description: The ListBox height in number of items that are initially displayed without scrolling. This setting overwrites height settings in terms of CSS size that have been made. When the items have different heights, the height of the first item is used for all other item height calculations. Note that if there are one or more separators between the visible ListBox items, the displayed items might not relate 1:1 to the initially specified number of items. When the value is retrieved, it equals the previously set value if it was set; otherwise, it will be the number of items completely fitting into the ListBox without scrolling in the case the control was already rendered. Note that if the control was not rendered, the behavior will be undefined, it may return -1 or any other number.
visibleItems.helpDescription: The ListBox height in number of items that are initially displayed without scrolling. This setting overwrites height settings in terms of CSS size that have been made. When the items have different heights, the height of the first item is used for all other item height calculations. Note that if there are one or more separators between the visible ListBox items, the displayed items might not relate 1:1 to the initially specified number of items. When the value is retrieved, it equals the previously set value if it was set; otherwise, it will be the number of items completely fitting into the ListBox without scrolling in the case the control was already rendered. Note that if the control was not rendered, the behavior will be undefined, it may return -1 or any other number.

enabled.description: Determines whether the ListBox is enabled or not. Can be used to disable interaction with mouse or keyboard. Disabled controls have another color display depending on custom settings.

scrollTop.description: Scroll bar position from the top. Setting the scrollTop property and calling scrollToIndex are two operations influencing the same "physical" property, so the last call "wins".

displayIcons.description: Determines whether the icons of the list items shall also be displayed. Enabling icons requires some space to be reserved for them. Displaying icons can also influence the width and height of a single item, which affects the overall height of the ListBox when defined in number of items. Note that the number of icons that can be displayed in the ListBox depends on the size of the icons themselves and of the total ListBox height.

sap.ui.commons.Splitter.description: Allows to split the screen into two areas. Make sure that the container for the splitter has an absolute height or set an absolute height for the splitter using the height property. Otherwise the height of the splitter is calculated by the height of its contents.
sap.ui.commons.Splitter.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Splitter. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSplitterOrientation splitterOrientation} : sap.ui.core.Orientation (default: Vertical)
    • {@link #getSplitterPosition splitterPosition} : sap.ui.core.Percentage (default: 50%)
    • {@link #getMinSizeFirstPane minSizeFirstPane} : sap.ui.core.Percentage (default: 0%)
    • {@link #getMinSizeSecondPane minSizeSecondPane} : sap.ui.core.Percentage (default: 0%)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getShowScrollBars showScrollBars} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSplitterBarVisible splitterBarVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFirstPaneContent firstPaneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getSecondPaneContent secondPaneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Splitter.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Splitter control.
Allows to split the screen into two areas. Make sure that the container for the splitter has an absolute height or set an absolute height for the splitter using the height property. Otherwise the height of the splitter is calculated by the height of its contents.

sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox.description: TriStateCheckBox to reflect mixed state for checkboxes. The control can display three states, namely checked, unchecked and mixed. However, mixed state cannot be directly reached by user interaction on the particular control. It can be only set by the control's public toggle function, to make a behaviour possible which is e.g. required in checkbox trees.
sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TriStateCheckBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSelectionState selectionState} : sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBoxState (default: Unchecked)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
TriStateCheckBox to reflect mixed state for checkboxes. The control can display three states, namely checked, unchecked and mixed. However, mixed state cannot be directly reached by user interaction on the particular control. It can be only set by the control's public toggle function, to make a behaviour possible which is e.g. required in checkbox trees.

sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer.description: Is used to provide a container, which can show different content depending on its current width. It fires an event, whenever a new range is reached. In addition the content of the new range is automatically shown, if it is set.
sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ResponsiveContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getRanges ranges} : sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getDefaultContent defaultContent} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rangeSwitch rangeSwitch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Is used to provide a container, which can show different content depending on its current width. It fires an event, whenever a new range is reached. In addition the content of the new range is automatically shown, if it is set.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep.description: Step used within a RoadMap Control.
sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RoadMapStep. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSubSteps subSteps} : sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep[] (default)

sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ResponsiveContainerRange. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getKey key} : string (default: )
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContent content} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.commons.TextField.description: Renders an input field for text input.
sap.ui.commons.TextField.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TextField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getImeMode imeMode} : sap.ui.core.ImeMode (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getDesign design} : sap.ui.core.Design (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getHelpId helpId} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getAccessibleRole accessibleRole} : sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole (default: Textbox)
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.TextField.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Input control.
Renders an input field for text input.

sap.ui.commons.FileUploader.description: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

value.description: Value of the path for file upload.
value.helpDescription: Value of the path for file upload.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

buttonText.description: The Button text can be overwritten using this property.
buttonText.helpDescription: The Button text can be overwritten using this property.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

buttonOnly.description: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.
buttonOnly.helpDescription: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

sameFilenameAllowed.description: If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.
sameFilenameAllowed.helpDescription: If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

multiple.description: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
multiple.helpDescription: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

uploadUrl.description: Used when URL address is on a remote server.

fileType.description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].
fileType.helpDescription: The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

uploadComplete.name: uploadComplete
uploadComplete.description: Event is fired as soon as the upload request is completed (either successful or unsuccessful). To see if the upload request was successful, check the 'state' parameter for a value 2xx. The uploads actual progress can be retrieved via the 'uploadProgress' Event. However this covers only the client side of the Upload process and does not give any success status from the server.

sap.ui.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout.description: The Absolute Layout positions its child controls absolutely
sap.ui.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/AbsoluteLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getVerticalScrolling verticalScrolling} : sap.ui.core.Scrolling (default: Hidden)
    • {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling} : sap.ui.core.Scrolling (default: Hidden)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPositions positions} : sap.ui.commons.layout.PositionContainer[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
The Absolute Layout positions its child controls absolutely

sap.ui.commons.TextArea.description: Control to enter or display multible row text.
sap.ui.commons.TextArea.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TextArea. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getCols cols} : int
    • {@link #getRows rows} : int
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : sap.ui.core.Wrapping
    • {@link #getCursorPos cursorPos} : int
    • {@link #getExplanation explanation} : string
    • {@link #getLabeledBy labeledBy} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.TextField#constructor sap.ui.commons.TextField} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.TextArea.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.TextArea control.

sap.ui.commons.MessageList.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MessageList. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAnchorId anchorId} : string
    • {@link #getMaxListed maxListed} : string (default: 7)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.MessageList.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 A new messaging concept will be created in future. Therefore this control might be removed in one of the next versions.

sap.ui.commons.TreeNode.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TreeNode. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHasExpander hasExpander} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIsSelected isSelected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelectable selectable} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getNodes nodes} : sap.ui.commons.TreeNode[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedForNodes selectedForNodes} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.commons.TreeNode)[]
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:toggleOpenState toggleOpenState} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selected selected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.commons.Tab.description: Represents a single tab in a TabStrip control.
sap.ui.commons.Tab.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Tab. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVerticalScrolling verticalScrolling} : sap.ui.core.Scrolling (default: None)
    • {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling} : sap.ui.core.Scrolling (default: None)
    • {@link #getClosable closable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.Panel#constructor sap.ui.commons.Panel} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Tab.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.TabContainer control.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout.description: Based upon the border layout as it comes with the Java standard. Using this layout, you are able to divide your available UI space into five areas whose sizes can be defined. These areas are: Top: Header; Bottom: Footer; Begin: Left/right-hand side panel; Center: Content area in the middle; End: Right/left-hand side panel.
sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/BorderLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getRtl rtl} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTop top} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getBegin begin} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getCenter center} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getEnd end} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getBottom bottom} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Page control.
Based upon the border layout as it comes with the Java standard. Using this layout, you are able to divide your available UI space into five areas whose sizes can be defined. These areas are: Top: Header; Bottom: Footer; Begin: Left/right-hand side panel; Center: Content area in the middle; End: Right/left-hand side panel.

Constructor for a new ImageMap. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getName name} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAreas areas} : sap.ui.commons.Area[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox
sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.MessageBox control.
Provides methods to create standard alerts, confirmation dialogs, or arbitrary message boxes. As MessageBox is a static class, a jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox"); statement must be explicitly executed before the class can be used. Example: 
  jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox");
  sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.show(
      "This message should appear in the message box.",
      sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Icon.INFORMATION,
      "My message box title",
      [sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.YES, sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.NO],
      function() { / * do something * / }
  );

sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator.description: Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. The indicator can be displayed with or without numerical values. The filling can be displayed in color only, or additionally with the percentage rate. The indicator status can be interactive.
sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ProgressIndicator. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBarColor barColor} : sap.ui.core.BarColor (default: NEUTRAL)
    • {@link #getDisplayValue displayValue} : string (default: 0%)
    • {@link #getPercentValue percentValue} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowValue showValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.ProgressIndicator control.
Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. The indicator can be displayed with or without numerical values. The filling can be displayed in color only, or additionally with the percentage rate. The indicator status can be interactive.

sap.ui.commons.Carousel.description: Carousel holds multiple controls and displays them vertically or horizontally next to each other. You can define how many content items should be displayed at once or let the Carousel determine that for you. Navigation is done through buttons or keys.
sap.ui.commons.Carousel.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Carousel. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.ui.commons.enums.Orientation (default: horizontal)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getDefaultItemHeight defaultItemHeight} : int (default: 150)
    • {@link #getDefaultItemWidth defaultItemWidth} : int (default: 150)
    • {@link #getAnimationDuration animationDuration} : int (default: 500)
    • {@link #getVisibleItems visibleItems} : int
    • {@link #getHandleSize handleSize} : int (default: 22)
    • {@link #getFirstVisibleIndex firstVisibleIndex} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Carousel.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Carousel control.
Carousel holds multiple controls and displays them vertically or horizontally next to each other. You can define how many content items should be displayed at once or let the Carousel determine that for you. Navigation is done through buttons or keys.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell.description: Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.
sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayoutCell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BackgroundDesign (default: Transparent)
    • {@link #getColSpan colSpan} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getHAlign hAlign} : sap.ui.commons.layout.HAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getPadding padding} : sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding (default: End)
    • {@link #getRowSpan rowSpan} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getSeparation separation} : sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation (default: None)
    • {@link #getVAlign vAlign} : sap.ui.commons.layout.VAlign (default: Middle)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Grid control.
Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.

rowSpan.helpDescription: Determines how many rows of the underlying grid structure are occupied by this matrix layout cell. In case a row-height is used, all rows affected by the RowSpan must have the same unit.

sap.ui.commons.InPlaceEdit.description: The InPlaceEdit is a functionality to have text in display mode that can be changed in place.
sap.ui.commons.InPlaceEdit.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new InPlaceEdit. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getUndoEnabled undoEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDesign design} : sap.ui.commons.TextViewDesign (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.InPlaceEdit.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
The InPlaceEdit is a functionality to have text in display mode that can be changed in place.

sap.ui.commons.MenuButton.constructorDescription:

The supported settings are:

  • Properties

  • Aggregations

  • Events
    • {@link #event:itemSelected itemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.Button#constructor sap.ui.commons.Button} can be used as well.

sap.ui.commons.TabStrip.description: TabStrip represents a container for tab controls, which contain the content and generally other controls. The user switches between the tabs to display the content.
sap.ui.commons.TabStrip.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TabStrip. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getSelectedIndex selectedIndex} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEnableTabReordering enableTabReordering} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTabs tabs} : sap.ui.commons.Tab[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:close close} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.TabStrip.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.TabContainer control.
TabStrip represents a container for tab controls, which contain the content and generally other controls. The user switches between the tabs to display the content.

sap.ui.commons.Image.description: A wrapper around the IMG tag. The image can be loaded from a remote or local server. There are various size setting options available, and the images can be combined with actions.
sap.ui.commons.Image.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Image. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSrc src} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getDecorative decorative} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAlt alt} : string
    • {@link #getUseMap useMap} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Image.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Image control.
A wrapper around the IMG tag. The image can be loaded from a remote or local server. There are various size setting options available, and the images can be combined with actions.
